Package org.apache.juneau.assertions

Class DateAssertion

java.lang.Object
org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentAssertion<R>
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentObjectAssertion<T,R>
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentComparableAssertion<Date,R>
org.apache.juneau.assertions.FluentDateAssertion<DateAssertion>
org.apache.juneau.assertions.DateAssertion
public class DateAssertion extends FluentDateAssertion<DateAssertion>
Used for assertion calls against Date objects.
Example:

// Validates the specified date is after the current date. assertDate(myDate).isAfterNow();

Test Methods:

  • FluentDateAssertion
    • is(Date,ChronoUnit)
    • isAfter(Date)
    • isAfterNow()
    • isBefore(Date)
    • isBeforeNow()
    • isBetween(Date,Date)
  • FluentComparableAssertion
    • isGt(Comparable)
    • isGte(Comparable)
    • isLt(Comparable)
    • isLte(Comparable)
    • isBetween(Comparable,Comparable)
  • FluentObjectAssertion
    • isExists()
    • is(Object)
    • is(Predicate)
    • isNot(Object)
    • isAny(Object...)
    • isNotAny(Object...)
    • isNull()
    • isNotNull()
    • isString(String)
    • isJson(String)
    • isSame(Object)
    • isSameJsonAs(Object)

    • isType(Class)
    • isExactType(Class)

    • setMsg

      public DateAssertion setMsg(String msg, Object... args)
      Description copied from class: Assertion
      Allows you to override the assertion failure message.

      String can contain "{msg}" to represent the original message.

      Example:

      import static org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*; // Throws an assertion with a custom message instead of the default "Value was null." assertString(myString) .setMsg("My string was bad: {msg}") .isNotNull();

      Overrides:
      setMsg in class FluentDateAssertion<DateAssertion>
      Parameters:
      msg - The assertion failure message.
      args - Optional message arguments.
      Returns:
      This object.

    • setOut

      Overrides:
      setOut in class FluentDateAssertion<DateAssertion>
      Parameters:
      value - The output stream. Can be null to suppress output.

      public DateAssertion setSilent()
      Description copied from class: Assertion
      Suppresses output to STDERR.

      This is the equivalent to calling out(null).

    • setThrowable

      public DateAssertion setThrowable(Class<? extends RuntimeException> value)
      Description copied from class: Assertion
      If an error occurs, throw this exception instead of the standard AssertionError.

      The throwable class must have a public constructor that takes in any of the following parameters:

      • Throwable - The caused-by exception (if there is one).
      • String - The assertion failure message.

      If the throwable cannot be instantiated, a RuntimeException is thrown instead.

      Example:

      import static org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*; // Throws a BadRequest instead of an AssertionError if the string is null. assertString(myString) .setThrowable(BadRequest.class) .isNotNull();

      Overrides:
      setThrowable in class FluentDateAssertion<DateAssertion>
      Parameters:
      value - The new value for this setting.
      Returns:
      This object.
